messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] WAS:stick figure moviesNOW: NAK ;)
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/28/2007 4:12:38 P.M. Pacific Daylight Time, polykow@kmtel.com writes: Portuguese.How old is your nursling? Mine is just 19 months old and
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/28/2007 4:12:38 P.M. Pacific Daylight Time,
polykow@... writes:

Portuguese.How old is your nursling?
Mine is just 19 months old and all I have to do is sit in the chair and she
comes and nurses and tries to kick the keyboard!
Alex


I have a 2 year old and a 4-almost-5 year old I am nursing :)

Portuguese! What a LOVELY language! It's so pretty, and a cousin to my DH's
Spanish :) Or perhaps a sister!

I have a friend elsewhere on the 'net that speaks it. It's so nicee to hear
it. I love languages and could sit and hear ones I don't know all
day...Spanish with my DH, Tagalog with my smom and her mom and...lol...Balmerese with my
grandparents! lol! (Baltimorons know that language, lol)

Love and thanks, Alex!
Karen

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] WAS:stick figure moviesNOW: NAK ;)
messages.msgSnippet: Portuguese.How old is your nursling? Mine is just 19 months old and all I have to do is sit in the chair and she comes and nurses and tries to kick the
messages.messageBody:
Portuguese.How old is your nursling?
Mine is just 19 months old and all I have to do is sit in the chair and she comes and nurses and tries to kick the keyboard!
Alex



----- Original Message -----
From: Kidgie@...
To: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Tuesday, August 28, 2007 5:45 PM
Subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] WAS:stick figure moviesNOW: NAK ;)



In a message dated 8/28/2007 9:03:31 A.M. Pacific Daylight Time,
polykow@... writes:

Yes I know, I was just trying to say it is OK if we don't get what other
prople find funny.
I don;t write as well as you all ( my excuse is that english is my second
languagelol) and I am always NAK . So I write short.
Alex

_____________________________________

Alex, me, too! I can sometimes do caps and punctuation, but not always ;)
NAK-ing is a way of life! lol!

What is your first language, if I may ask?

Karen
